Replies.Reply: We've got a real problem here, something right up your alley.
Eighteen hours ago I was informed that one of our choppers, transporting three presidential cabinet members from this charming little country, was shot down...
...The pilots radioed from the ground that they were all alive.  Their position was fixed by the transponder beacon onboard the chopper.
That's the problem.  Apparently they strayed off course.
We're certain they've been captured by the guerrillas.
We figure we've got less than twenty-four hours to catch up with them.  After that, there's not much hope.  We want a rescue operation mounted tonight.  That doesn't give you much time.
You lift off in three hours.
Someone else will be going in with you.
I'm afraid those are your orders, Major.  Once you reach your objective, Dillon will evaluate the situation and take charge.
You'd better get your men ready.
If it hadn't been for her, he'd be dead now.  That story she told us...I still can't believe it.
It's been a long time, General.
What have you got in mind, General.
What else it new?  When do we leave?
You know we don't work with outsiders, General.
Dillon, you son of a bitch.
You've been pushing too many Pencils, Dillon.  Had enough?
You never did know when to quit.
Wasn't my style.  We're a rescue unit, not assassins.
This must be good.  Big shot from the CIA, leaves his desk to come back to the bush.
And nothing we can't handle alone.
This gets better by the minute.
You never were all that smart...let's go!!!
Took 'em out with a heat seeker.
Heat seeker.  Pretty sophisticated for half-asses mountain boys.
Get ahead, see what you can find.
I knew this man.  Green Berets, out of Fort Bragg.  What the hell were they doing in here?  You got any answers for this, Dillon?
I can't believe Jim Hopper walked into an ambush.
What about the rest of Hopper's men?
Let's get it over with.  We move.
Hawk, Get Con. Op. on the hook!  Position and situation, now!
Good work, Mac.  Clear the area, no traces.  Get the men ready to move.
I think this is the one you want.
It was all bullshit.  All of it.
What story did you give to Davis?
Tell Mac we move in five.
We take her and she'll give away our position, every chance she gets.  No prisoners, Dillon.
I'm getting my men out of this damn jungle, Dillon.  She's your baggage.  You fall behind, you're on your own.
This place is too hot for a pick-up.
Not much choice.  Pancho, take the lead.  Double time it.
Lock n' load, watch your ass.
Billy...What the hell's wrong with you?
Where the hell is his body?
Why didn't they take the radio and his weapon?
I want him found.  Sweep pattern and double back.  Fifty meters.
...Just like the others...no powder burns, no shrapnel.
We're losing the light.  Mac, I want a defensive position above this ridge, mined with everything we're got.
Put him in his poncho and liner and carry him back.
I'm sorry, Bull.  It's never easy.  He was a good soldier.
Bullshit.  You're just like the rest of us.
You still don't get it, do you Dillon?  He took Davis...
Get a field dressing on that right away.
He came back for the body.
He's killing us, one at a time...
Anna.  He's hunting us.  You know that?
care who we are, who she is.
If it bleeds, we can kill it.
He'll be looking for the trip wires.
Get Ramirez on his feet!  Take the girl and get the hell out of here!
You know you can't win this one.
Come on, Poncho, we're getting out of here.
Billy, take the radio, leave the rest.  Come on!
Who said anything about outsiders, Dutch?
Last time we danced, it was Lieutenant, Schaefer.
That piece of work you guys pulled off at the Berlin embassy last week was really something.  Blew the entry points on three floors and neutralized the opposition in eight seconds flat.
Also heard that you passed on that little job in Libya.

Those cabinet members are very important to our scope of operations in this part of the world.  They're about to get squeezed.  We can't let that happen.  I needed someone who could get the job done, quick and quiet...no screw-ups.  I needed the best.
Not to worry, Dutch.  I haven't lost my edge.  They've got a head start on us in some real tough country, otherwise, believe me, it's a piece of cake.
Our rendezvous points and radio freqs. are indicated and fixed.  AWACS contact on four hour intervals.
Man, that's a real bad habit you've got.
You don't know how much I missed this, Dutch!!!  Once you get this in your blood, you never get it out!!!
Have you picked up their trail yet?
They're getting better equipped every day.
Uh...I wasn't told of any operations in this area.  They shouldn't have been here.
This is beautiful!  More than we ever thought.  We got the bastards!
That's right, I set you up.
Because I told you, you're the best.  I knew you could do it but I couldn't get you in here without a cover story.
was sent in to get my men.
To invade a foreign country, illegally?  You lied, Dillon.
But things changed, I woke up.
She's too valuable.  She's got to know their whole network.  The whole set up.
You're still under orders, Dutch.  You want to make the call, or should I?
It's a long walk back, make it easy on yourself.
She looks at him contemptuously, undaunted.  She will try it again.  She breaks away from his grasp and moves on, Dillon watching her go, he won't hesitate next time.
They did the same thing to Davis...
The wound all fused, cauterized...what the hell did this?
We're still too far in, they won't risk coming in for us.
I can accept that, it comes with the job.
Ask her again.  What did she see?  What happened to Hawkins?
He's losing his cool.  There's nothing out there but a couple of men that we're going to have to take down.
Shit, you trying to tell me Blain and Hawkins were killed by a fucking lizard?  Don't listen to her.  Its's a psych-job.
What the hell do you think you're doing?
Now what, Dutch.  You going to send your mystery guest an invitation?
Satisfied?  Now let's get the hell out...
Guess I've picked up some bad habits from you, Dutch.  Now don't argue with me, you know I'm right.  Get to that chopper and hold it for us.
You know me, Dutch, I never did know when to quit.
We both got scores to settle.
Redbird Two, Two.  Bearing south, three, five, zero, one o'ckock on the saddle ridge.
Roger, Blue Leader.  Three, five, zero, on your move.
Hey, Billy, how many marines does it take to eat a squirrel?
Two.  One to eat it and one to watch for cars.
Major, we stepped into some real shit here.  I got a hook-up with aerial surveillance.
Schaefer touches him on the shoulder.
Get that stinkin' thing out of my face, Blain!
The pilots have each got one round in the head.  And whoever hit it stripped the shit out of it.
I don't think that was any ordinary army taxi...
...looks more like a surveillance bird to me.
Must have run into the guerrillas ...Fucking animals.
Hell, dude, we don't have all day.
You should put her on a leash, Agent Man.  If you can't handle her, just say the word.
Major, you'd better take a look at this.
She says...the jungle came alive, and took him...
Couple of sappers been trailing us all the way from the camp, Major.  Billy heard them.  She set us up, ran for it...They were waiting.
Shit load o' good a chopper'd do us in here anyway.
You know something Billy, what is it?
Bullshit.  You ain't afraid of no man.
Came in through the trip wires, took it right out from under our noses...
Why didn't he try to kill one of us last night?
I know what you mean, Bull, but don't sweat it, me and 'ol 'painless' here are watchin' the front door.
Son of a bitch's dug in like a Alabama tick...
I hear you bro, this is some shit.  Makes Cambodia look like Kansas.  Lose your way in here, man, you be in some kinda hurt.
Come on in you fuckers...come on in.  'ol 'painless' is waitin'...
Leader to Bird Two Two.  I bear two minutes to Landing Zone.
Two, Two, leader.  Roger your insert co-ord.  Over.
Major, looks like there were ten, maybe twelve guerrillas.  Looks like they took some prisoners from the chopper.
Then a different set of track, over there.
Six others, U.S. issue jungle boots.  They came in from the north, then followed the guerrillas.
Strange, Major.  There was a firefight.  Shooting in all directions.
I don't believe he did, Sir.
No sign.  They never left here Major.
Looks bad, Major.  It's gonna be a real bitch.
If we follow above the river and then down, here, at this canyon, we might find a way out.
There's something out there, waiting for us...it ain't no man.
Boar set off the trip flare, Major.  No other tracks.
Ain't no way for a soldier to die.
Time to let 'ol 'painless' out of the bag.
You're ghostin' on me, mother fokaaa!...I don't care who you are back in the world...

No.  Shithead with his trenchcoat and dee-coda-da ring was makin' enough noise to get us all waxed.  I don't like that guy.  Don't like him at my back.  I ain't winding up like those bastards back there.
I've seen some badass bush before, but nothin' like this, man.
Can't say, Major...been squirrely all mornin'...
Ramirez runs from the jungle, breathing hard, shaking his head.
We've got most of the flares, frags. and two claymores just outside.  Nothin's comin' close to here without trippin' on somethin'.
The best friend I ever had.
Don't know, only saw one of 'em.  Camouflaged.  He was there...
Those eyes...disappeared.  But I know one thing, Major...
...I drew down and fired right at it.  Capped-off two hundred rounds and then the Mini-gun; the full pack.
It's the same kinda jungle, Bro, same moon...
...we walked out on top of 'em.  Not a scratch, not a fuckin' scratch.
No fuckin' chili-choker got to you, Bro...you were just too good...
...Right, I got a score to settle for the Bro...
You touch me again, pig, and I will cut off your balls!
When my people catch you, you'll wish you were him.
I don't know what it was.
It changes colors, like the chameleon.  It uses the jungle...
There is something else.  When the big man was killed, you must have wounded it.
It's blood was on the leaves.
When I was little we find a man --

-- like a butcher.  The old ones in the village cross themselves and whisper crazy things.  'Demonio, cazador de trofoes...Only the hottest times of the hottest years...'  Crazy things...This year is grows hot.  And we begin finding our men.  We find them sometimes without their skin.
Red Fox, I say again.  Your request for extraction denied.
Looks like he's been through hell...can't believe he's still alive.  What the hell went on down there?
